SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Lights
Class Light

java.lang.Object
  SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Node
      SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Lights.Light
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGL_Renderable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DirectionalLight, PointLight
public abstract class Light
extends Node

This class is an abstract base class for nodes of a scene graph that represent lights. The color of the light is used for both the specular and diffuse color for the light. By default, the ambient color is not used, unless a value has been set for the how much the light contributes to the ambient light using the setAmbientFactor() method.

Constructor Detail

Light

public Light(int light_num,
             java.awt.Color color)
Construct a new light node, using the specified OpenGL light and color.

Parameters:
light_num - The number from GL_LIGHT1 to GL_LIGHT7 to use for this light. The light number is clamped to be between GL_LIGHT1 and GL_LIGHT7. If a value smaller than GL_LIGHT1 is passed in, GL_LIGHT1 will be used. If a value larger than GL_LIGHT7 is passed in, GL_LIGHT7 will be used. Applications should use the symbolic names GL.GL_LIGHT1 through GL.GL_LIGHT7, since these values are NOT typically mapped to 1..7.
color - The color to use for this light.

Light

public Light(int light_num)
Construct a new light node, using the specified OpenGL light and a default color of GRAY.

Parameters:
light_num - The number from GL_LIGHT1 to GL_LIGHT7 to use for this light.

setEnable

public void setEnable(boolean on_off)
Set flag indicating whether or not this light is turned on.

Parameters:
on_off - flag indicating whether to turn this ligth on or off.

setColor

public void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
Set the color of this light. If color is null this method has no effect.

Parameters:
color - The new color to use for this light.

setAmbientFactor

public void setAmbientFactor(float factor)
Set the fraction of this light that will be used for ambient light calculations. If the fraction is zero, the ambient components of this light will be set to zero so there is no contribution to ambient light. The fraction used is clamped between 0 and 1.

Parameters:
factor - The fraction of this light (between 0 and 1) that will be used for the ambient light.

Render

public void Render(net.java.games.jogl.GLDrawable drawable)
Use OpenGL calls to use the specified light, if it is enabled.

Parameters:
drawable - The drawable on which the light is to be used.
